Scheduler Support¶

LavaStorm can talk to a number of schedulers including OpenLava, (Using the command line, C API, or through openlava web) and Sun Grid Engine. Adding support for new schedulers is easy. Schedulers are implemented using two components: SimpleJob - a very simple class that represents an active job, implements a method to kill the job, and provides attributes that denote the status of the job and its IDs; and JobManager - the actual interface to the scheduler that provides methods to retrieve a job or jobs, and submit new jobs into the batch scheduling system.

SimpleJob¶

class lavaStorm.SimpleJob(job_id, array_index, is_running=False, is_pending=False, is_completed=False, is_failed=False, is_suspended=False, was_killed=False)[source]¶

SimpleJob is a very simple job implementation providing just enough information for LavaStorm to make decisions, and no more. Job Managers are free to either subclass SimpleJob, or use a different implementation entirely however the following methods and attributes MUST be implemented.

At least one of the following attributes must be true. All must be defined.

is_running¶

True if the job is executing on the cluster.

is_pending¶

True if the job is pending execution

is_completed¶

True if and only if the job has completed successfully.

is_failed¶

True if and only if the job failed

is_suspended¶

True if the job is currently suspended

was_killed¶

True if the job was killed by the end user or administrator

job_id¶

The numerical Job ID

array_index¶

The numerical array index, zero if not part of an array,

kill()¶

Kill the job using the job scheduler.

JobManager¶

class lavaStorm.JobManager[source]¶

Job Managers are responsible for submitting, monitoring the state of, and killing jobs.

Openlava Web¶

class lavaStorm.OpenLavaRemoteManager[source]¶

Job Manager for the OpenLavaWeb server. Uses REST calls to manage jobs.
